nodes.content: Systemic Therapy (NSCL-K 1 of 5) or Systemic Therapy, Subsequent (NSCL-K 4 of 5)

tree_references.description: Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis

footnotes.label: nn
footnotes.content: Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H).

footnotes.label: rr
footnotes.content: Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease (NSCL-J).

footnotes.label: ttt
footnotes.content: Contraindications for treatment with PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors may include active or previously documented autoimmune disease and/or current use of immunosuppressive agents; some oncogenic drivers (ie, EGFR exon 19 deletion or L858R; ALK, RET, or ROS1 rearrangements) have been shown to be associated with less benefit from PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors. If there are contraindications, refer to NSCL-K 1 of 5 (adenocarcinoma) or NSCL-K 2 of 5 (squamous cell carcinoma).

footnotes.label: uuu
footnotes.content: For patients who require an urgent start to therapy but molecular testing is pending, consider holding immunotherapy for one cycle, unless confirmed that no driver mutations are present.

footnotes.label: vvv
footnotes.content: If patient has not received platinum-doublet chemotherapy, refer to "systemic therapy." If patient received platinum chemotherapy and anti-PD-1/PD-L1, refer to "subsequent therapy."
